column3: I guess it's a strict improvement, but shouldn't it be using the user-configured value??

@luke-jr this value is the one that "rejects" too-low values, aka something that simply cannot propogate. Once a user picks a rate(above that) it sticks to it.\n\n(although I guess this can change too depending on current mempool minfee, eh?)
hmm I thought I tested this locally but this is obviously wrong, closing

> aka something that simply cannot propogate

Literally anything CAN propagate.

Network policies are not constants, and should assume to vary.

Not sure why you're necroing this PR.
